1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: WN_BORD.C Fri 10-27-2000 9:34:42 pm HvA V2.01 $
3    | 
4    | DESC: Border routines for HVA_WIN
5    | HIST: 20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for DJGPP
6    | ***************************************************************************/
7    | 
8    | #include "video/v_video.h"
9    | #include "window.h"
10   | 
11   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
12   |    FUNCTION: wn_border()
13   |     PURPOSE: Draw a border around a window
14   |      SYNTAX: int wn_border(WINDOW *w, int style);
15   | DESCRIPTION: WINDOW *w = pointer to a window control block
16   |              int style = style of border to draw
17   |              The style does not change the attribute of the border.
18   |     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW: window not opened
19   |              TRUE     : all ok
20   |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1
21   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
22   | int wn_border(WINDOWPTR w, int style)
23   | {
24   | 
25   |   wn_log("wn_border(%p,%s, style = %2d)\n",w,w->title,style);
26   | 
27   |   /*----------------------------------
28   |     Check if window opened and topped
29   |   -----------------------------------*/
30   |   if (!w)
31   |     return(NO_WINDOW);
32   |   if (w != top_window)
33   |     wn_top(w);
34   | 
35   |   if (w->btype != _NO_BORDER) {
36   |     wn_setbox(style);
37   |     v_drawbox(w->wy1,w->wx1,w->xsize,w->ysize,w->bcolor);
38   |     return(TRUE);
39   |   }
40   |   else
41   |     return(FALSE);
42   | }
43   | 
44   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
45   |    FUNCTION: wn_dborder()
46   |     PURPOSE: Draw a border around a window
47   |      SYNTAX: int wn_dborder(WINDOW *w,
48   |                             int ul, int ur, int tb, int sd, int ll, int lr);
49   | DESCRIPTION: Sets box characters and calls wn_border
50   |              ul = upper left
51   |              ur = upper right
52   |              tb = top/bottom
53   |              sd = sides
54   |              ll = lower left
55   |              lr = lower right
56   |     RETURNS: Always TRUE
57   |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
58   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
59   | #ifdef DONT_SKIP_THIS
60   | 
61   | int wn_dborder(WINDOW *w, int ul, int ur, int tb, int sd, int ll, int lr)
62   | {
63   |   wn_log("wn_dborder(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
64   | 
65   |   /*------------------------
66   |     Check if window opened
67   |   --------------------------*/
68   |   if (!w)
69   |     return(NO_WINDOW);
70   |   if (w != top_window)
71   |     wn_top(w);
72   | 
73   |   v_setboxchars(ul,ur,tb,sd,ll,lr);
74   |   wn_border(w,w->btype);
75   |   return(TRUE);
76   | }
77   | 
78   | #endif
79   | 
80   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
81   |     FUNCTION: wn_setbox()
82   |      PURPOSE: Set box outline-art to double or single lines
83   |       SYNTAX: void wn_setbox(int style);
84   |  DESCRIPTION: The style can be _SINGLE_LINE or _DOUBLE_LINE
85   |               …ÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕª ⁄ƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒø ÷ƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒ∑  ’ÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕ∏  ’ÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕ∏
86   |               ∫ FRAME 0 ∫ ≥ FRAME 1 ≥ ∫ FRAME 2 ∫  ≥ FRAME 3 ≥  ≥ FRAME 4≥
87   |               »ÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕº ¿ƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒŸ ”ƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒΩ  ‘ÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕÕæ  ¿ƒƒƒƒƒƒƒƒŸ
88   | 
89   |                           ‹ ‹ ‹‹‹‹‹‹‹ ‹  ∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞  ±±±±±±±±±±±  ≤≤≤≤≤≤≤≤≤≤
90   | 
91   |                 FRAME 5   › FRAME 6ﬁ  ∞ FRAME 7 ∞  ±FRAME 8  ±  ≤FRAME 9 ≤
92   | 
93   |                           ﬂ ﬂ ﬂﬂﬂﬂﬂﬂﬂ ﬂ  ∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞∞  ±±±±±±±±±±±  ≤≤≤≤≤≤≤≤≤≤
94   | 
95   |               €€€€€€€€€€  ********** ‹
96   |               €FRAME 10€  *FRAME 11*
97   |               €€€€€€€€€€  **********
98   |      RETURNS: nothing
99   |      HISTORY: 910717 V0.1 - Initial version
100  |               920920 V0.2 - Added additional frame types
101  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
102  | void wn_setbox(int style)
103  | {
104  |   switch (style) {
105  |                     /* setboxchars( ul, to, ur, ri, lr, bo, ll, le); */
106  |     case _SINGLE_LINE: v_setboxchars(218,196,191,179,217,196,192,179); break;
107  |     case _DOUBLE_LINE: v_setboxchars(201,205,187,186,188,205,200,186); break;
108  |     case FRAME_0     : v_setboxchars(218,196,191,179,217,196,192,179); break;
109  |     case FRAME_1     : v_setboxchars(201,205,187,186,188,205,200,186); break;
110  |     case FRAME_2     : v_setboxchars(214,196,183,186,189,196,211,186); break;
111  |     case FRAME_3     : v_setboxchars(213,205,184,179,190,205,212,179); break;
112  |     case FRAME_4     : v_setboxchars(213,205,184,179,217,196,192,179); break;
113  |     case FRAME_5     : v_setboxchars( 32, 32, 32, 32, 32, 32, 32, 32); break;
114  |     case FRAME_6     : v_setboxchars(220,220,220,222,223,223,223,221); break;
115  |     case FRAME_7     : v_setboxchars(176,176,176,176,176,176,176,176); break;
116  |     case FRAME_8     : v_setboxchars(177,177,177,177,177,177,177,177); break;
117  |     case FRAME_9     : v_setboxchars(178,178,178,178,178,178,178,178); break;
118  |     case FRAME_10    : v_setboxchars(219,219,219,219,219,219,219,219); break;
119  |     case FRAME_11    : v_setboxchars('*','*','*','*','*','*','*','*'); break;
120  |     default          : v_setboxchars(218,191,191,179,217,196,192,179); break;
121  |   }
122  | }
